result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Laron N King

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Laron N King appeared by video.  Attorney Connor Romenesko appeared by video for Laron N King.  Prosecuting attorney Thomas Hasle in court for the State of Wisconsin. 
Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing.  Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.   Defendant is advised that this case is assigned to Judge VanGrunsven Branch 09.   Original Information filed.  Copy given to defense counsel who waived reading.  Defendant pled not guilty. Court ordered case adjourned for Scheduling Conference in Branch 09.
Scheduling conference scheduled for December 13, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Laron N King appeared by video.  Attorney Connor Romenesko appeared by video for Laron N King.  Prosecuting attorney Arthur Kenneth Thexton in court in person for the State of Wisconsin. 
Case is set for a Preliminary Hearing. State's Witness is not present but a subpoena was issued. Case is adjourned. Court ordered case adjourned for CAUSE for a Preliminary Hearing in Preliminary Hearing Court, Room 146 of the Criminal Justice Facility.
Preliminary hearing scheduled for October 21, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Laron N King in court.  Attorney Connor Romenesko in court for Laron N King.  Prosecuting attorney Patrick T. Franken in court for the State of Wisconsin. 

Case in Court for Status Conference.  Attorney Romenesko has recently been appointed by the SPD's office.  Matter needs to be calendared for Preliminary Hearing. Case adjourned to Preliminary Court.
Preliminary hearing scheduled for September 22, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Laron N King in court.  Patrick T. Franken appeared for Attorney Francesco Mineo for the State of Wisconsin.

Court conducted Indigency Hearing. Court held colloquy with defendant. Court finds the Defendant indigent.   Case passed to allow time to determine if Defendant is eligible for representation by the PD's office.

1:43 pm Case is recalled.  Attorney Connor Romenesko appears as friend of the Court, on behalf of PD's office. Defendant is eligible for representation by the State Public Defender's Office.  Court adjourns this matter for Status of Counsel hearing before Br. 9.  Status conference scheduled for September 13, 2022 at 02:00 pm.

Defendant Laron N King in court.  Gregg Herman appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  PARTIES APPEAR IN PERSON
Case set for a preliminary hearing. Defendant appears without counsel.  Court orders the case adjourned for CAUSE for an Indigency Hearing.   
*Pursuant to Chief Judge Directive 22-04, parties are hereby notified that effective 7/30/22, this case is assigned to branch 9, Judge Paul Van Grunsven in room 632 of the Courthouse.  Indigency hearing scheduled for August 9, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Court ordered no contact with Citgo Gas Station 3708 West North Avenue
No Contact/No Weapons Order, signed and filed.

Court ordered Justice Point Pretrial Services LEVEL 2 SUPERVISION.  Court reminders.  Court ordered no possession or use of controlled substances without a valid prescription.  No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.

Defendant Laron N King in court with attorney Michael J Cerniglia.  Defendant Laron N King in custody.  Nate Kristian McClure appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Stark, Branch 17.  Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.  Defense enters a plea of NOT GUILTY as to misdemeanor count 2. DEFENDANT IS NOT ELIGIBLE FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER.  Pursuant to Chief Judge Directive 22-04, parties are hereby notified that effective 7/30/22, this case is assigned to branch 9, Judge Paul Van Grunsven in room 632 of the Courthouse.  
  This hearing will be streamed live on Dacast:  https://iframe.dacast.com/live/4dafbf46-ed15-c11c-fa22-a58262833632/99073afd-37c2-acfa-830d-b1ddcaebf0ea  Preliminary hearing scheduled for July 25, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
